document.docAuthor: Alwin-Kownacka, Alicja, Szadziewski, Ryszard & Szwedo, Jacek
document.masterDocTitle: Predatory midges of the tribes Palpomyiini and Sphaeromiini (Diptera: Ceratopogonidae) from the Middle East, with keys and descriptions of new species

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Predatory midges of the tribes Palpomyiini and Sphaeromiini (Diptera: Ceratopogonidae) from the Middle East, with keys and descriptions of new species

mods:name.mods:affiliation: urn: lsid: zoobank. org: author: 0995 CC 31 - 5 CC 8 - 46 F 3 - BB 72 - A 4 D 76919750 A & Corresponding author: alicja. alwin @ biol. ug. edu. pl

Email: jacek. szwedo @ biol. ug. edu. pl & urn: lsid: zoobank. org: author: 36 BAE 161 - ECCD- 4 D 89 - B 383 - C 7 CC 84 FF 0 A 89

subSubSection.paragraph: Body brown, scutellum slightly paler. Legs brown, mid and hind legs darkest; fore tibia with distinct pale band at apex (poorly developed on mid tibia); tarsomeres 1–4 yellow, with more or less brown tips, tarsomeres 5 brown; fore femur slightly swollen, with 8–9 ventral spines, mid femur slender, with 5–6 spines, hind femur with 8–10 spines; tarsomeres 5 with 6 massive ventral batonnets; female claws equal, long, curved, with basal inner teeth. Female with 2 sub-equal, rounded seminal capsules with short necks, and distinct seminal duct.

caption.paragraph: Table 1. Zoogeographical elements among the Middle East Palpomyiini and Sphaeromiini .

Tajikistan, Turkmenistan; Oman, United Arab Emirates
Azerbaijan, Europe, Kazakhstan, Mongolia, S Russia, Tajikistan; Iran, Iraq, Turkey
Armenia, Georgia, Kazakhstan, Europe; Turkey, Israel
China, Europe, Japan, Kazakhstan, Kyrgyzstan, Russia; Israel
North America, Azerbaijan, N China, Europe, Georgia, Japan, N and NW Russia, Tajikistan; Turkey

Freidberg leg. ( TAU ); 2 ♀♀ , same collection data except 23 May 2003 ( TAU ); 1 ♀ , En HaHoresh, 21 May 2005 , A. Freidberg leg. ( TAU ).
